item.title: Tihana add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Compassion is the basis of morality." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "There is no perfection only life" -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "I have no brakes on...analysis is for those who are paralyzed by life." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Hemingway, Ernest
item.description: "I drink to make other people more interesting." -- Hemingway, Ernest

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Why do people have to be this lonely? What's the point of it all? Millions of people in this world, all of them yearning, looking to others to satisfy them, yet isolating themselves. Why? Was the earth put here just to nourish human loneliness?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "I am against religion because it teaches us to be satisfied with not understanding the world." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "Live by the harmless untruths that make you brave and kind and healthy and happy." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "She hated people who thought too much. At that moment, she struck me as an appropriate representative for almost all mankind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Joseph Heller
Tihana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Bathsheba loved Troy in the way that only self-reliant women love when they abandon their self-reliance. When a strong woman recklessly throws away her strength she is worse than a weak woman who has never any strength to throw away. One source of her inadequacy is the novelty of the occasion. She has never had practice in making the best of such a condition. Weakness is doubly weak by being new." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Tell him,' the colonel said, smiling, 'that a person doesn’t die when he should but when he can." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Tihana add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Things have a life of their own," the gypsy proclaimed with a harsh accent. "It's simply a matter of waking up their souls." -- Gabriel García Márquez
